org.jscsi.target.storage

Interface IStorageModule

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RandomAccessStorageModule, SynchronizedRandomAccessStorageModule

    public interface IStorageModule
    This is an abstract super class offering methods for storage and retrieval of data, as well as emulating some properties of block storage devices.

    All index and length parameters used by the read and write methods are referring to bytes, unlike the values sent in CommandDescriptorBlock s.

    Author:
    Andreas Ergenzinger

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static class  IStorageModule.STORAGEKIND
      Enum to denote the modules.

    • Method Detail

      • checkBounds

        int checkBounds(long logicalBlockAddress,
              int transferLengthInBlocks)
        This method can be used for checking if a (series of) I/O operations will result in an IOException due to trying to access blocks outside the medium's boundaries.

        The SCSI standard requires checking for these boundary violations right after receiving a read or write command, so that an appropriate error message can be returned to the initiator. Therefore this method must be called prior to each read or write sequence.

        The values returned by this method and their meaning with regard to the interval [0, getSizeInBlocks() - 1] are shown in the following table:

        Return Value Meaning
        0 no boundaries are violated
        1 the logicalBlockAddress parameter lies outside of the interval
        2 the interval [logicalBlockAddress, logicalBlockAddress + transferLengthInBlocks]
        lies outside of the interval, or transferLengthInBlocks is negative

        Note that the parameters of this method are referring to blocks, not to byte indices.

        Parameters:
        logicalBlockAddress - the index of the first block of data to be read or written
        transferLengthInBlocks - the total number of consecutive blocks about to be read or written
        Returns:
        see table in description

      • getSizeInBlocks

        long getSizeInBlocks()
        Returns the storage space size in bytes divided by the block size in bytes (rounded down).
        Returns:
        the virtual amount of storage blocks available

      • read

        void read(byte[] bytes,
        int bytesOffset,
        int length,
        long storageIndex)
          throws IOException
        Copies bytes from storage to the passed byte array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the array into which the data will be copied
        bytesOffset - the position of the first byte in bytes, which will be filled with data from storage
        length - the number of bytes to copy
        storageIndex - the position of the first byte to be copied
        Throws:
        IOException

      • write

        void write(byte[] bytes,
         int bytesOffset,
         int length,
         long storageIndex)
           throws IOException
        Saves part of the passed byte array's content.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the source of the data to be stored
        bytesOffset - offset of the first byte to be stored
        length - the number of bytes to be copied
        storageIndex - byte offset in the storage area
        Throws:
        IOException

      • close

        void close()
           throws IOException
        Closing the storage.
        Throws:
        IOException - to be closed
